description: This chapter describes Jonah's obedience to the LORD's second command to go to Nineveh, and how the people of Nineveh repented and God spared them.

questions.question: How many times did the word of the LORD come unto Jonah?
Where did the LORD tell Jonah to go?
What did the LORD tell Jonah to do in Nineveh?
options: Preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee

questions.question: How did Jonah go unto Nineveh?
options: According to the word of the LORD

questions.question: What kind of city was Nineveh?
options: An exceeding great city of three days' journey

questions.question: How far did Jonah begin to enter into the city?
What did Jonah cry and say?
options: Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown

questions.question: What did the people of Nineveh do?
options: Believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth

questions.question: How did the people of Nineveh put on sackcloth?
options: From the greatest of them even to the least of them
From the least of them even to the greatest of them

questions.question: Who did word come unto?
What did the king do when he arose from his throne?
options: Laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes

questions.question: Whose decree did the king cause it to be proclaimed by?
options: By the decree of the king and his nobles
By the decree of the king only
By the decree of his nobles only
By the decree of his people

questions.question: What did the king command not to be done throughout Nineveh?
options: Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste any thing: let them not feed, nor drink water

questions.question: What did the king command man and beast to do?
options: Be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God

questions.question: What did the king command everyone to turn from?
options: Turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands

questions.question: What did the king say about who can tell?
What did the king say God might do?
options: Turn and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger

questions.question: Why did the king say this?
What did God see that made him repent?
options: Their works, that they turned from their evil way

questions.question: What did God do regarding the evil he had said he would do unto them?
options: Repented of the evil, that he had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not
